author: jeremyk
title: Parcel Delivery MVP Testing
description: Postal services in African countries are expensive, unreliable, slow, inconvenient, inefficient and even inaccessible to many people according to reports of the Universal Postal Union (UPU).

f6_assessments.q0:
A very great proposal that of course, aligns with the challenge setting with the aim of onboarding some new members and as well creating Yoroi wallets for them in addition to education. Definitely, if the number of Yoroi users increases with a transaction flow, then it means the Cardano ecosystem is seeing some great impact of growth. The problem indicated in this proposal is a valid use case that needs to be given attention. However, speaking from the Ghanaian perspective, I see it may be very hard for a successful implementation even though a good solution has been written in their proposal submitted under the DApps, Products, and Integration challenge.
This proposal is complimented with some key metrics that will help the community to measure not only its success but the impact it will have on the Grow Africa, Grow Cardano ROI. From my perspective, the information provided aligns with the majority of the campaign brief and thus making it impactful.
f6_assessments.q1:
Despite the fact that this proposal is well written and possibly will be receiving nice accolades from my fellow PAs that I may possibly agree with, I would like to take the pain in the ass to point out some critical concerns that need to be addressed by the proposing team just so they are able to improve on their draft for possible successful funding in subsequent funding rounds ahead of us and if not this time.
The fact that this proposal is reliant on successful funding and implementation of the proposal put into DApps, Products, and Integration raises some concerns that were not addressed with alternatives in this proposal. 
For instance, what happens to this proposal if it's funded but the other one doesn't get funded? 
How will the team account for what they've won? 
What happens if both proposals are funded but the technical team is not able to deliver a successful implementation of the MVP within the given timeframe as stated in the roadmap of the proposal?
Did the team perform any on-grounds research to confirm the feasibility studies of this project? You may want to rely on some research done by some group of people some time ago but the truth is, people's behavior changes from time to time especially when there's a difficulty.
Despite the fact that the idea may sound laudable, and of course, it's laudable, these concerns need to be given attention to ensure a successful implementation.
Due to the lack of answers to these concerns in the proposal, I am uncertain about successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is sufficient for a successful auditory process by the community but what is lacking is exactly where this progress can be tracked by the community aside from the monthly reporting form. The team does well to provide 3 working links to nice websites of which one is under-development. I think it would have been awesome for the team to just indicate in this proposal exactly which of these websites can be used to track the progress of this project. Even though it was stated that the findings of this project will be documented in a GDoc and shared publicly. This is a great initiative but where would the community get the link to this GDoc? This is where the website becomes useful.
I do agree with every other information provided under the auditability criteria of this proposal except with what I feel is lacking as described above and hence my score of 4.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the “MVP testing” only. The MVP for this parcel delivery itself is stated in this proposal: https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/416992/, which is submitted in Dapps, Products & Integrations. This testing proposed here is very crucial for this project, because locals would be both senders and transporters, and hence the users of the platform. The proposer even connected with both WADA and Ariob, which are both operating locally-oriented. The challenge is chosen good, because the testing would be based in and benefit Africa. The only problem I see here is, that people who would be testing would probably need ADA (for the deposit), and I hope that this project does not make financial advice about what the test-persons should do with their money, because ADA is a highly volatile asset.
f6_assessments.q1: The problems I see with feasibility are first and foremost that the delivery of this proposal depends on the delivery of the other one (MVP dApp), and I ask myself what happens if this one gets funded but the other one doesn’t. Also, there’s a DAO mentioned but I don’t get the purpose and integration of it. I hope the proposer has a good look into what DAOs exactly are and do, and whether that would really benefit the operations of this project. Also, you could open management to decentralization anytime you and the project are ready, you don’t have to integrate it from the start. Furtherly, there are many risks listed, and I am very pleased seeing this critically reflecting thinking. It’s very assuring of the proposer’s competencies – but also, the solutions seem not complete. I feel like there will be a lot of progress and re-alignment as soon as the project starts forming. Apart from the concerns, the budget looks very feasible, and I trust the proposer because of the meaningful connections already made. Even if the way the project goes may become a bumpy one, I am excited to find out whether the project works for the locals. It seems like a super cool idea, and I would love to see it have the possibility to give it a go.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability is ensured through a Google Docs, which I figure (and hope) will be accessible through the project’s webpage. The timeline looks good but is again dependent on the main proposal. This is in my mind not a downside to the auditability, so I keep the full stars. Everything else looks auditable as well. I even figure that this proposal is a kind of KPI for the main proposal, which speaks heavily for auditability, because of the clear purpose.

f6_assessments.q0:
Looking at adoption, the proposal is addressing the challenge with the aim to address the inefficiencies in postal services. The proposal is also looking at the first phase to conduct a report to understand the needs and problems of the postal sector so as draw conclusions and have blockchain technology system to improve service delivery and trust. 

This is important to enhance service delivery. However, the proposed solution with its focus on market analysis, is quite broad to be conducted in the entire Africa and even in two countries. A focal country is important to test and drive the innovation since problems of the postal services in Africa are the same.  

The proposal also has been able to identified lots of risks but the mitigation plans should have a clear roadmap to tackle them.
f6_assessments.q1:
There exist a good and experience team that understands the postal ecosystem and delivery services. The team also has a good collaboration with WADA, which has presence in the two countries (Cameroon and Ghana). With such experiences the project could take off and successfully implemented. The deliverables clear but with tight schedules looking the geographical locations of the two contraries and culture, the team should not expect activities could be implemented easily. Also the two countries have  different postal systems and structures and that the deliverables can't be the same. 

The budget is very reasonable but not that detailed for each disbursement. For example, giving out $500 for each wada hub would be used to execute what?
If the team is funded they should reconsider the milestones, timelines and provide detailed budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
Though it is a survey report, there ought be KPIs and metrics to help in the auditing process. Interview of 100 responded for a study like should have some expected measurable outcomes to guide the evaluation of the proposal. 

The team has been able to however showed how success would look like by gaining knowledge on how the postal service has evolved to guide the usage of the technology.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal meets the settings of this challenge because it is answering a very critical problem in Africa especially in Ghana. Delivering parcels across regions or cities in Africa is very difficult, inconvenient and expensive. 
Adopting Blockchain based solution like what is described in this proposal is close to the perfect solution needed. 
It will provide employment or a side hustle for many who are employed or else have jobs that are not sustainable. By engaging this service on the Cardano Blockchain, trust issues are dealt with it also creates awareness of the ecosystem. This may lead to participation in Cardano and project catalyst and adoption of Cardano/ADA as Blockchain and cryptocurrency of choice among users. This aspect of the proposal is to pilot the MVP in Africa and use interviews to evaluate the impact and scalability of the project which I think is a step in the right direction. 
This idea is great.
f6_assessments.q1:
The funds requested for is reasonable for such a project. The budget well elaborate and clear. The proposers have listed all items that are included in the budget. Since the building of the App is in a different proposal I believe a detailed budget on the building of the App will de included there.
The proposers also outlines all team members, their relevant experience and skills that are needed in successfully running the proposal and also provide links with evidence of relevant experience. 
There is also a step by step plan and milestones with timelines that are pragmatic. Risks that are listed are practical and the strategies for mitigation are good. 
I think this proposal can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have listed KPIs that are measurable and simple. I am glad that they listed "what success looks like". The key milestones and timelines are also understandable. They state that data from the interviews will be used to evaluate the impact and scalability of the project. Reports will also be made available to the community and this means the proposal is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
Software testing improves reliability and high quality that deliver  error free application 
Which in turn creates a better user experience and increases more users in the Cardano Ecosystem. I can see the overall Impact to the cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q1:
There is a testing roadmap that is divided into two phases  that contain four periods  each with the final period integrating the feedback from users into the MVP which will eventually improved the APP.

There is a detailed budget breakdown  and amount carefully allocated to budget items.

The Partnership with the Ariob Incubator increases the feasibility because of the availability of experts and mentors from the Incubator  to guide the team.

f6_assessments.q2:
The team hopes to provide a public Testing Report for the community

It would be nice to have metrics to monitor the number of testers completed in each month.
There was no quantified way what success would look like in 1 , 2 and 3 months, how many tester and feedback would be integrated in each month?
We know there are targeting 100 testers but to audit the progress,  each month should have a target number.
The start and delivered date depends on the funding of another proposal.
I would suggest the Team quantified their KPI and Metrics that will increase auditability of the proposal.  Overall the auditability can be improve and each month targets added.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, the proposal certainly meets what we are looking for in the challenge. The suggested solution is to create a new approach to the delivery service in Africa. Leaving the traditional centralized postage system and replacing it with a peer-to-peer approach based on Cardano's blockchain. This is necessary since African countries' postal services are difficult in many ways: expensive, unreliable, slow, inefficient, etc. In this way, the proponents ask for funding for the study and elaboration of their minimum viable product (MVP), and it aims to collect different types of data (quantitative and qualitative), understand how the design interface would be built, understand the application of the technology blockchain in that use case and etc. Honestly, I thought it was a very good and innovative proposal, I don't remember seeing another one in the same area (post office). Surely the idea will be as profitable for Africa as it is for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of script, the way the activities are explained is excellent. There is a lot of detail, my only suggestion would be to break the time into more standardized intervals, for example months. What would happen in month 1, and in month 2? We know what happened in 2021 in relation to the project, what was done from February and then from September. But our understanding is not as specific as I would like, in terms of temporality. The use of funding could be explained a little better, in which case the parts themselves should be more detailed. In period two why would each hub need an investment of 2500 dollars? As for the team, that part is great. We know who those involved are and how they relate to Cardano, their linkedin profiles, etc. My suggestion here is that we know a more standardized amount of information about each, as some include more detail than others.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability of progress includes some KPIs, such as: feedback on the business model and MPV by stakeholders, learning insights from practical research, etc. It is said that this data will be made public by google docs, it is excellent that the proponents have already defined some communication channel with the community; only the frequency at which the information would be updated should have been provided (I advise at least once a month). Regarding the auditability of success, we have a good definition of what is expected (“valid data through which we can get solid insights on whether the idea has the potential to fly and be adopted by people”, etc.). But how would this information be converted into tangible and demonstrable data for our community? We needed a more practical view of this study. Would this information also be shared by google docs?

solution: We test the dApp MVP on Cardano for a cheaper, faster and greener P2P postal delivery solution allowing anyone to deliver parcels going there anyways while making an extra income at the same time.
experience: Besides 3 years of working experience in int. dev. cooperation, we have several years of experience in IT ranging from Haskell/Plutus to frontend development. This is complemented by the local business experience coming from WADA hubs and the Ariob Incubator located in Africa.
